emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Software Development
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems capable of autonomously coding, debugging, and deploying software with minimal human intervention.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces need for human coders, increases efficiency, raises concerns about job displacement and the ethics of AI in creative processes.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High initial cost, need for trust in AI decisions, regulatory frameworks for AI ethics, and integration with existing development environments.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural-Interface Smart Glasses
emerging_technologies.description: Glasses that integrate with the brain to provide augmented reality experiences or cognitive enhancements through direct neural connections.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for cognitive enhancement, privacy concerns, and changes in how we interact with technology and each other.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Cost, health safety concerns, ethical considerations regarding enhancement, and user comfort with invasive technology.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Drone Swarms
emerging_technologies.description: Drones operating in coordinated swarms for tasks requiring spatial distribution and dynamic response.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Improvement in productivity, privacy issues, potential for misuse in warfare or surveillance.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulation of airspace, public perception of privacy, technological reliability, and economic viability.

emerging_technologies.name: Blockchain-Enhanced Digital Identity
emerging_technologies.description: A decentralized identity verification system leveraging blockchain for secure, user-controlled personal data.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances personal privacy, reduces identity theft, challenges existing business models for data monetization.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory acceptance, user education, integration with existing systems, and addressing security concerns.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Coding Assistants
mainstream_technologies.description: AI tools that assist in coding, debugging, and optimizing software development processes.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in both enterprise and open-source development environments, significantly altering the workflow of developers.

mainstream_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Cryptography
mainstream_technologies.description: Cryptographic systems designed to withstand attacks from quantum computers.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in financial sectors, government communications, and critical infrastructure.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards greater automation in all facets of life and work, driven by advancements in AI.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Potential for significant productivity gains, but also raises concerns about employment, inequality, and human-AI interaction.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing investment in AI education, ethical AI frameworks, and regulatory measures to manage AI's societal impact.

epoch_themes.description: Focus on securing personal data and digital identity in an increasingly interconnected world.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Empowers individuals with control over their digital footprint, challenging traditional data collection practices.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Growth in decentralized systems, privacy laws, and public demand for data protection.
